title: sync: Failed to handle p2p RPC error=collector does not exist for topic
body:
# üêû Bug Report

### Description

Many debug logs print in rapid succession, process is unable to shutdown gracefully.

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

Yes. Beta.0

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

User reported this occurred when trying to shut down a beacon node

Send exit signal to running beacon node.

*Note: I have not reproduced this yet myself.*

## üî• Error

```
[2020-11-03 18:26:47] DEBUG sync: Failed to handle p2p RPC error=collector does not exist for topic /eth2/beacon_chain/req/ping/1/ssz_snappy
```

## üåç  Your Environment

**Operating System:**


**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)**

User reports they were running from master

**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?**
@farazdagi could you take a look please?

OS:  Ubuntu AMD64, but this was exitFix branch by Nishant (e751b2ad9d6c9df388330736a6e904984ada9486) a couple of days ago which was merged into master.  But I've been having this issue on master itself in the last week or more.  Sometimes it exits gracefully with a single ctrl+c, sometimes it just does this and it has to be killed.

This is because we actually force a checkpoint. So while we wait for that to happen our p2p service is still running, we should pre-emptively remove our handlers when stopping our sync service. This is a side effect of #7625 being merged in, so a solution to this would be to shut down our services in sync better. #7723 should fix this.
